content: On the debt side and for interest rates, I mean 2022 has been an extreme year of interest rate increases and I think that our expectation is that theyâve got a little main ways further to go up, but itâs not going to continue to go up at this pace for the next two, three, four years that thereâs going to be a point that has reached where the Fed has done its job and you start to see inflation turn where theyâre going to slow down the increases in the Fed rate, which will affect SOFR and that will start to moderate and you know potentially turn the other way, if the economy weakens like we have been talking about.
